bioghist.p: Bolton Brown (1864-1936) was an artist and lithographer. He was the founder of the art department of Stanford University and the Woodstock Art Colony in New York. As a master printer, Brown worked with George Bellows, John Sloan, and Rockwell Kent.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Bolton Brown's journals and notebooks on etching and lithography. The journals contain detailed accounts of Brown's technical experiments with inks, crayons, stones, and other lithographic materials. The notebooks contain notes and sketches. Also included in the collection is a bound typescript of an unpublished book by Brown titled "Lithography Since Whistler," a 1938 catalog of his lithographs, a bound copy of his book Lithography for Artists (1929), and a copy of Crayonstone, a book on Brown's life and work by Clinton Adams (1993).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
